title: Function def. by integral, graph of segments part - b

content.description: The function f is defined on the closed interval [-5, 4]. The graph of f consists of three line segments and is shown in the figure above. Let g be the function defined by \(g\left(x\right)=\int_{-3}^xf\left(t\right)dt\).
content.question: On what open intervals contained in -5<x<4 is the graph of g both increasing and concave down? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: On what open intervals contained in -5<x<4 is the graph of g both increasing and concave down? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
